newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Four groups eye Philippine power plant contract.
newsitem.headline: Four groups eye Philippine power plant contract.

text.p: Four foreign and local groups have expressed interest in competing for a contract to rehabilitate a 350-megawatt National Power Corp hydroelectric plant in Laguna, south of Manila, the Philippine generator said on Tuesday.

Cerael Donggay, NPC vice-president, told reporters the groups were local firm First Private Power Corp, a consortium made up of Alsons Power Holding Corp and Tomen Corp, CalEnergy International of the U.S. and Asiapower Developments Ltd of New Zealand.
Donggay said bids for the rehabilitation of the Caliraya-Botocan-Kalayaan hydro complex would be accepted on November 25.
Impsa Asia Ltd of Argentina had earlier submitted an unsolicited bid. It will now have to match the tender of the lowest bidder to win the project.
Under the Philippine build-operate-transfer (BOT) law, other companies are allowed to challenge unsolicited proposals. The lowest bidder wins the contract.
